V550.title: ðŸ“œ Codex Amendment V-5.5.0 â€“ The Containment Clause

summary.text: Authorizes governing standards to contain subordinate doctrinal modules through the reserved key 'containedModules', thereby permitting hierarchical containment without violating Codex uniformity.

Article I â€“ Definition.text: The property 'containedModules' is a sanctioned structural key in the Codex schema. It may appear only within objects of type 'standard', 'taxonomy', or other designated 'governingDoctrine' types.

Article II â€“ Scope.text: Contained modules must conform to full Codex object schema and inherit their parentâ€™s doctrinal lineage while retaining unique identifiers.

Article III â€“ Interpretation.text: Contained modules are subordinate for hierarchy mapping yet remain accessible through the global Codex registry for cross-reference, ensuring recursive and flat access.

Article IV â€“ Application.text: All foundational doctrinesâ€”including Document Standards, Time Interval Standards, and Data Exchange Standardsâ€”shall adopt 'containedModules' for direct subordination. Non-governing objects continue to use relational keys such as 'isSubordinateTo' or 'dependsOn'.

Article V â€“ Transitional Provisions.text: Legacy keys ('submodules', 'tier', 'hierarchyOrder') will be migrated to 'containedModules' by Codex v5.6 while preserving backward compatibility.
